main_definition: The act of recovering or obtaining something that was lost, hidden, or previously removed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To get back possession of a stolen item after it has been recovered by authorities or the rightful owner
meanings_and_examples.example: The police were able to retrieve his missing wallet.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To obtain data or information from a database, system, or source that was previously unavailable or removed
meanings_and_examples.example: After hours of searching, they finally managed to retrieve the lost files from their server backup.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To recover something physically, such as an object or body part, after it has been moved, hidden, or misplaced
meanings_and_examples.example: The hiker was relieved when she successfully retrieved her phone that had fallen into the creek.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To recover a memory from one's mind, often as a result of cues or reminders
meanings_and_examples.example: He managed to retrieve the name of his old school friend after seeing an old photograph.
